description: Changjiang Comprehensive Shopping Mall has 5000 m² of space for lease and plans to attract the following 5 types of stores as tenants. The table below shows the area occupied by each type of store for one shop, the minimum and maximum number of shops for each type within the mall, and the expected annual profit (in ten thousand yuan) per store for different numbers of stores. Each store pays 20% of its annual profit as rent to the mall. Question: How many of each type of store should the mall lease to maximize total rental income? Table 5-12 | Code | Store Type | Area per Shop / m² | Min | Max | 1 Store | 2 Stores | 3 Stores | |------|------------|--------------------|-----|-----|---------|----------|----------| | 1 | Jewelry | 250 | 1 | 3 | 9 | 8 | 7 | | 2 | Shoes & Hats | 350 | 1 | 2 | 10 | 9 | - | | 3 | General Merchandise | 800 | 1 | 3 | 27 | 21 | 20 | | 4 | Bookstore | 400 | 0 | 2 | 16 | 10 | - | | 5 | Catering | 500 | 1 | 3 | 17 | 15 | 12 |

TotalSpace.definition: Total available space for lease in the mall

RentPercentage.definition: Percentage of annual profit paid as rent

AreaJewelry.definition: Area occupied by one jewelry shop

AreaShoesHats.definition: Area occupied by one shoes & hats shop

AreaGeneralMerch.definition: Area occupied by one general merchandise shop

AreaCatering.definition: Area occupied by one catering shop

MinShoesHats.definition: Minimum number of shoes & hats shops

MinGeneralMerch.definition: Minimum number of general merchandise shops

MaxShoesHats.definition: Maximum number of shoes & hats shops

MaxGeneralMerch.definition: Maximum number of general merchandise shops

ProfitJewelry1.definition: Annual profit for jewelry shop when 1 store

ProfitJewelry2.definition: Annual profit for jewelry shop when 2 stores

ProfitJewelry3.definition: Annual profit for jewelry shop when 3 stores

ProfitShoesHats1.definition: Annual profit for shoes & hats shop when 1 store

ProfitShoesHats2.definition: Annual profit for shoes & hats shop when 2 stores

ProfitGeneralMerch1.definition: Annual profit for general merchandise shop when 1 store

ProfitGeneralMerch2.definition: Annual profit for general merchandise shop when 2 stores

ProfitGeneralMerch3.definition: Annual profit for general merchandise shop when 3 stores

ProfitBookstore1.definition: Annual profit for bookstore when 1 store

ProfitBookstore2.definition: Annual profit for bookstore when 2 stores

ProfitCatering1.definition: Annual profit for catering shop when 1 store

ProfitCatering2.definition: Annual profit for catering shop when 2 stores

ProfitCatering3.definition: Annual profit for catering shop when 3 stores

objective.description: "The goal is to maximize the total rental income from leasing stores to tenants"
objective.formulation: $\max RentPercentage \times (NumJewelry \times ProfitJewelry + NumShoesHats \times ProfitShoesHats + NumGeneralMerch \times ProfitGeneralMerch + NumBookstore \times ProfitBookstore + NumCatering \times ProfitCatering)$
objective.code:
model.setObjective(
    RentPercentage * (
        (NumJewelry * ProfitJewelry1) * (NumJewelry == 1) +
        (NumJewelry * ProfitJewelry2) * (NumJewelry == 2) +
        (NumJewelry * ProfitJewelry3) * (NumJewelry == 3) +
        
        (NumShoesHats * ProfitShoesHats1) * (NumShoesHats == 1) +
        (NumShoesHats * ProfitShoesHats2) * (NumShoesHats == 2) +
        
        (NumGeneralMerch * ProfitGeneralMerch1) * (NumGeneralMerch == 1) +
        (NumGeneralMerch * ProfitGeneralMerch2) * (NumGeneralMerch == 2) +
        (NumGeneralMerch * ProfitGeneralMerch3) * (NumGeneralMerch == 3) +
        
        (NumBookstore * ProfitBookstore1) * (NumBookstore == 1) +
        (NumBookstore * ProfitBookstore2) * (NumBookstore == 2) +
        
        (NumCatering * ProfitCatering1) * (NumCatering == 1) +
        (NumCatering * ProfitCatering2) * (NumCatering == 2) +
        (NumCatering * ProfitCatering3) * (NumCatering == 3)
    ), 
    GRB.MAXIMIZE
)

constraints.description: Total area occupied by all stores should not exceed the total available space of 5000 m²
constraints.formulation: $NumJewelry \\times AreaJewelry + NumShoesHats \\times AreaShoesHats + NumGeneralMerch \\times AreaGeneralMerch + NumBookstore \\times AreaBookstore + NumCatering \\times AreaCatering \\leq TotalSpace$
constraints.code: model.addConstr(NumJewelry * AreaJewelry + NumShoesHats * AreaShoesHats + NumGeneralMerch * AreaGeneralMerch + NumBookstore * AreaBookstore + NumCatering * AreaCatering <= TotalSpace)

constraints.description: Number of jewelry shops should be at least the minimum required
Number of shoes & hats shops should be at least the minimum required
Number of general merchandise shops should be at least the minimum required
Number of bookstores should be at least the minimum required
Number of catering shops should be at least the minimum required
Number of jewelry shops should not exceed the maximum allowed
Number of shoes & hats shops should not exceed the maximum allowed
Number of general merchandise shops should not exceed the maximum allowed
Number of bookstores should not exceed the maximum allowed
Number of catering shops should not exceed the maximum allowed

NumJewelry.definition: Number of jewelry stores to lease

NumShoesHats.definition: Number of shoes & hats stores to lease

NumGeneralMerch.definition: Number of general merchandise stores to lease

NumCatering.definition: Number of catering stores to lease
